data.title: All the Tory MPs who lost their seats in the general election
data.meta_description: The Conservative Party has suffered a devastating defeat in the 2024 general election, with Rishi Sunak's party losing XX incumbent MPs in seats across the UK and Sir Keir Starmer becoming the next prime minister with a majority of XX. Tory politicians who have been booted out of office include XXX
data.text:
Just like countless polls predicted, Rishi Sunak’s Conservative Party has lost the general election to Sir Keir Starmer’s Labour Party, and lost 252 incumbent Tory MPs as a result.

Sir Keir Starmer said the country was “ready for change” as Labour appeared on course for a landslide win in the General Election.

The Labour leader, who will become the UK’s next Prime Minister, said “you have voted, it is now time for us to deliver”.An exit poll indicated Labour is forecast to have a 170-seat majority in the Commons, with the Conservatives reduced to their lowest number of MPs on record.

At the time of writing Top Tory names such as Liz Truss, Grant Shapps, Penny Mordaunt, Therese Coffey, Jacob Rees-Mogg and Johnny Mercer have all lost their seats to Labour, Lib Dem, Reform and Plaid Cymru.

Below is a list of all the Tories that have lost their seats so far:

Johnny Mercer, Plymouth

Stephen Metcalfe, South Basildon and East Thurrock

Anne Marie Morris, Newton Abbot

Kevin Foster, Torbay

Selaine Saxby, North Devon

Marcus Fysh, Yeovil
